review_blob: Bottle: Poured a hazy amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of vinous notes with light funky ester and some oak notes is quite interesting. Taste is also a mix of pinot notes with some funky notes with some oak and light tart notes are also perceptible. Body is full with good carbonation. Lacks a bit of attenuation but I like the fact that the barrel are really bringing some additional complexity.
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Cuves du Chai Saison Pinot Noir

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a cloudy peachy/pinkish color ale with a medium size foamy head with limited retention and not much lacing. Aroma of light passion fruit notes with hibiscus and oak is pretty unique and refreshing. Taste is a nice mix of passion fruit with light hibiscus and some oak with light funky barnyard notes. Body is full with limited filtration and some light carbonation. Nice refreshing drink with nice use of passion fruit with some good level of complexity.
beer_name: Wild Beer / Burning Sky / Good George Shnoodlepip

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a pale yellow color ale with a large white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of citrusy, grapefruit and light tropical notes is quiet awesome. Taste is a wonderful mix of citrusy and grapefruit floral notes with some tropical fruits notes and some light residual sugar notes with some subtle bitter flavours. Body is about average with good carbonation. Wonderful juicy APA with great drinkability. Definitely the best from this series.
beer_name: Beyond the Pale Pale Ale Project #6

review_blob: Growler: Poured a pale bright yellow color ale with a large white foamy head with good retention and light lacing notes. Aroma of floral hoppy undertones with some fruity ester and some light melon notes. Taste is also a mix of subtle hops notes with nice floral undertones touch and light fruity notes with subtle residual sugar notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Solid beer with nice subtle touch of hops and very limited bitterness.
beer_name: Beyond the Pale Pale Ale Project #5

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a bright yellow color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of tart notes with subtle peach undertones and light oak notes is pretty nice. Taste is also a mix of peach aromas with some light tart notes and oak with limited acidity is quite wonderful. Light funky Brett ester are also noticeable. Body is about average with good carbonation. Nice mix of complexity and drinkability with nice peach undertones.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy deep brown color ale with a medium size dark brown foamy head with light retention and some lacing. Aroma of bourbon and wood with some deep caramelized malt with some residual sugar notes is pretty nice. Taste is also a good mix of wood notes with some bourbon and light vanilla notes with some caramelized malt and some residual sugar notes. Body is full with limited filtration and good carbonation with light warming alcohol notes. Nice beer thought perhaps not the best from this series.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of sour notes with light acidic fruit notes is quite intriguing, Taste is a mix of tart notes with some light funky ester and some fruity acidic notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Solid beer from this new brewery with great level of complexity and some good drinkability.
beer_name: Blood Brothers Paradise Lost: Persimmon Sour

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a clear bright yellow color ale with a large white foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of fruity hops with some citrusy and tropical fruit notes is really nice. Taste is also a great mix of citrusy hops notes with some tropical fruits and light residual sugar notes. Body is about average for style with good carbonation. Very well brewed and great way to showcase this hops.

Bottle: Poured a clear black color stout with a large brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of roasted malt with black chocolate notes and light fruity ester is pleasant. Taste is a nice mix of roasted malt with some black chocolate notes and some fruity ester with light rustic notes. Body is about average with great carbonation. Not a big fan of the style but this take was quite enjoyable the Belgian yeast strain did give a different twist.

Bottle: Poured a hazy dirty yellow color ale with a medium size foamy head with good retention and some light lacing notes. Aroma of Brett notes with some vinous notes and light oak notes is pretty awesome. Taste is a nice mix of vinous notes with some oak and tart notes with some dry Brett notes and light funky barnyard notes. Body is full with good carbonation. Very solid beer with great level of complexity and good level of drinkability with well-balanced acidity level.

Bottle: Poured a light bright orangey color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of citrusy hops notes with some tropical notes is quite enticing. Taste is also a nice mix of residual sugar notes with some citrusy notes with some tropical flavours and a dry finish with light bitter notes. Body is quite full with good carbonation. Quite enjoyable for the style though the Brett yeast notes can be readily discernable and probably need more time in the bottle to develop.
beer_name: Pit-Caribou IIPA de la Sorcire Version 3

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a bright pale yellow color ale with a nice large pure white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of delicate citrusy hops notes with some grassy floral undertones. Taste is also a good mix of grassy notes with some citrusy hops notes is pretty nice. Body is about average with good carbonation. Nice but hops flavours could have been even more pronounced.

Growler: Poured a clear golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of tart notes with light mango notes is pleasant enough. Taste is mix of light mango notes with some tart notes and some light grainy notes and fruity ester. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not bad but missing a little bit of balance.

Bottle: Poured a bright amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of citrusy malt with light resin with floral undertones is quite nice. Taste is also a nice mix of citrusy hops notes with light resin and floral undertones with some malt notes also noticeable. Body is full with good carbonation. Solid IPA with great drinkability though maybe malt is little bit more upfront then I had expected.

Bottle: Poured a hazy reddish color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of vinous notes with oak and cherry with some tart notes is quite nice. Taste is a nice mix of cherry and oak with some tart notes and a vinous feel. Body is full with good carbonation. Nice level of complexity with some great drinkability.

Can: Poured a bright amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of caramel malt with some citrusy hoppy notes. Taste is also a mix of caramelized malt with some citrusy hops and some bitter notes in the aftertaste. Body is full enough for style with good carbonation. Too much caramel malt with maybe tad too much bitterness for my taste.

Bottle: Poured a clear bright yellow color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of dry hoppy notes with light Sauvignon notes is interesting. Taste is also a mix of light residual sugar notes with some dry Sauvignon notes and floral undertones. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not bad but I thought the hops could have been even more upfront.
beer_name: La Chouape / La Barberie SMASH Nelson Sauvin

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a nice dark brown foamy head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of chocolate malt notes with some light bourbon and some light roasted malt. Taste is a quite nice mix of chocolate malt notes with light roasted malt notes offset by some vanilla and bourbon notes with a smooth finish. Body is full with nice creamy texture and some good carbonation with no warming alcohol. Solid BA stout.

beer_brewer_name: Microbrasserie Le Castor - Le Castor Brewing Co.
review_blob: Bottle: Poured a hazy dirty golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and light lacing. Aroma of dry Brett notes with some light spicy yeast notes and some vinous notes are also perceptible. Taste is a good mix of dry Bretty notes with some tart and vinous notes with light spicy yeast notes. Body is full enough for style with good carbonation. Closer to a sour then a tripel but well brewed nonetheless.
beer_name: Le Castor Sanctuaire (fts de vin rouge + brettanomyces)

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a deep hazy brown color porter with a medium size dark brown foamy head with light retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of chocolate and deep caramelized malt with some residual sugar notes and bourbon notes. Taste is quite sweet with some residuals sugar notes, some chocolate notes and some vanilla and bourbon notes with light woody notes. Body is quite full with good carbonation and light warming alcohol notes. Not bad but a bit too sweet and cloying for my taste.

Bottle: Poured a pale bright yellow color ale with a large pure white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of light citrusy hops notes with light fruity undertones is pleasant. Taste is also a good mix of citrusy hops with yeasty undertones and some fruity undertones. Body is light with good carbonation. Hops may not shine as much as I would like but well balance overall with great level of attenuation.

Bottle: Poured a super light yellow color ale with a large bubbly head with limited retention and limited lacing. Aroma of tart and acidic notes with some subtle clementine notes. Taste is also a mix of very subtle clementine notes with some acidic notes and some tart notes. Body is light with good carbonation. Not bad but maybe a tad too acidic for my taste.

Bottle: Poured a light yellow color ale with a nice large foamy head with god retention and limited lacing. Aroma of light tart notes with honey is pleasant. Taste is also a nice mix of honey, light cereal notes with a lemony tart finish. Body is light with good carbonation. Lacking a little something but still enjoyable and quite refreshing.

Bottle: Poured a clear copper color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of nice smoky notes with light caramel notes is pretty awesome. Taste is a nice mxi of smoky notes with light peat and woody notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Nice dominant smoky notes with some balance with the malt backbone.

Bottle: Poured a pale yellow color ale with a large white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of floral hops notes with citrusy and grassy notes is wonderful. Taste is also a wonderful mix of floral hops with almost no bitterness and some grassy notes and citrusy notes with light residual sugar notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Solid juicy IPA.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of toffee and caramelized malt with light oak notes with dry hops notes. Taste is a mix of caramelized malt with light toffee notes, some oak notes and some light residual sugar notes. Body is about average for style with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol notes. Pretty good barleywine that should be brewed on a more regularly basis.
beer_name: Great Lakes Brewing Oak Aged Barley Wine

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a bright yellow color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of soapy notes with loads of yeasty notes is more or less pleasant. Taste is also a mix of soapy notes with yeasty aroma and weird fund flavours is not to my likings. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not sure what this beer was really about and not a beer I would seek again.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of citrusy hops with some bitter notes is pleasant enough. Taste is a mix of citrusy hops with subtle fruity notes and a bitter aftertaste with a distinctive malt backbone. Body is full with good carbonation. Not bad bit not sure I get the New Zealand hops notes I was really looking forward to.

Bottle: Poured alight reddish color ale with a medium size foamy head with OK retention and light lacing. Aroma of light cranberry notes with some tart notes. Taste is a mix of light lactic notes with some tart notes and light cranberry notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Good refreshing example of the style though it might be lacking a little bit of character.

Bottle: Poured an orangey color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of floral hoppy notes of citrus and pine is pretty pleasant. Taste is also a great mix of floral hoppy notes of citrus and pine with light residual sugar notes. Body is full with good carbonation. Well brewed IPA but hops notes could me more dominant.

Bottle: Poured a bright yellow color ale with a nice large off-white foamy head with good retention and light lacing. Aroma of peppery yeast notes with dry rye malt notes is pretty pleasant. Taste is a great mix of peppery yeast notes with dry rye malt and some rustic malt notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Nice mix of rye malt with loads of character from the yeast strain.

Bottle: Poured a hazy orangey color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and minimal lacing (the bottle was somewhat of a gusher). Aroma of light tart notes with fresh lemonade notes is quiet pleasant. Taste is also a great mix of lemonade with some tart notes and hints of residuals sugar notes. Body is full for style with good carbonation. Very well brewed with the right mix of complexity and drinkability.

Bottle: Poured a clear light golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some light lacing notes. Aroma of dry coffee notes with some citrusy hops notes is singular but enjoyable. Taste is a mix of floral bitter coffee notes with some citrusy hops notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Interesting mix and well balanced bitterness but not sure this is the type of beer I need to drink on a regular basis.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color ale with a medium size foamy head with OK retention and light lacing. Aroma of residual sugar ad light cereal notes is OK. Taste is a mix of quite a bit of residuals sugar notes with some cereal and light fruity ester. Body is about average with good carbonation. The NZ hops notes are quite a bit subtle and dont play a huge role as I would have expected.

Bottle: Poured a bright amber color ale with a large white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of cereal and peppery notes is enjoyable. Taste is a nice mix between some peppery yeast notes, some cereal and light citrusy hoppy notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Enjoyable and easy to drink though hoppy side could me more pronounced.
beer_name: Forked River Riptide Rye Pale Ale

review_blob: Growler: Poured a light golden ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some minor lacing notes. Aroma of unrefined grain and light hoppy notes is not as pleasant as I would have liked. Taste has light unrefined grainy notes with some light citrusy hops notes with some bitter notes in the aftertaste. Body is about average for style with good carbonation. There is something slightly off with the malt bill that didnt work out for me with this beer.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of bitter hops with some light sweet wheat malt notes is OK. Taste is bitterer then I was expecting with the wheat malt not really playing a huge role. Some citrusy notes can also be detected. Body is about average with good carbonation. OK but I dont feel the Mosaic hops are shining as much as they could.

Bottle: Poured a light reddish color ale with a large foamy head with OK retention and no lacing. Aroma of raspberry with light cough syrup notes. Taste is also a mix of raspberry and cereal with light cough syrup and subtle hints of residual sugar notes. Body is light good carbonation. I didnt particularly enjoy the cough syrup notes that I found in this beer.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a large dark brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of nice dark chocolate notes with some bourbon and vanilla notes. Taste is a great mix of black chocolate notes with some roasted malt notes and some bourbon notes and vanilla. Body is full with good carbonation with some light warming notes of alcohol. Not bad but I was expecting even more complexity.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Barrel-Aged Narwhal Imperial Stout

review_blob: Bottle: Poured a deep reddish color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of rich cherry notes with plenty of oak notes and some tart notes with some light residual sugar notes. Taste is a perfect mix of fresh cherry notes with some tart notes and oak with some residual sugar notes. Body is full with great carbonation.

Bottle: Poured a clear light yellow color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of light citrusy notes with some sauvignon notes. Taste is lighter then I was expecting with light hoppy notes with citrusy undertones and a light finish. Body is light with good carbonation. A bit short on flavours and the Nelson Sauvin hops are not shining as much as they could.

Bottle: Poured a golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of green grassy notes is pretty pleasant. Taste is also a great mix of green grassy hops with floral citrus notes with a smooth finish which is probably due to the use of oat malt. Body is about average with good carbonation. Well brewed and I enjoyed the smooth and creamy texture of the oat malt.

Bottle: Poured a golden color ale with a large white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of citrusy notes with some mint notes s unique and interesting. Taste is also a mix of citrusy hops notes with some mints ester and light spicy undertones is quite original. Body is about average with good carbonation. Interesting mix of flavours.

Bottle: Poured a light clear golden color ale with a medium size white foamy head with light retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of light tart notes with some citrus undertones is OK. Taste is also a mix of light tart notes with subtle citrus undertones. Body is light with medium carbonation. Not bad but lack some of the complexities I would have hoped for.

Bottle: Poured a clear dark black color ale with a large dark color head with good retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of green hoppy notes with light citrus flavours and some dry roasted malt. Taste is a nice mix of dry roasted malt with some green citrusy hoppy notes with medium bitter finish. Body is a bit light for style with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol notes. Not a big fan of the style but this one was quite enjoyable.

Bottle: Poured a clear light copper color Alt with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of dry caramel malt with light cereal notes is quite enticing. Taste is also a mix of dry caramel malt notes with some clean cereal notes. Body is about average for style with good carbonation. Not bad for the style but missing some of the yeast signature associated to the style.

Bottle: Poured a deep black color porter with a large light brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of dry chocolate and cacao notes with some light sugary notes is quite exquisite. Taste is also a quite wonderful mix between some cacao powder notes with some light sugary notes and some light residual sugar notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Pretty bang on the style with good level of complexity while retaining some drinkability.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a large dark brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of deep black chocolate notes with some bourbon notes and vanilla notes easily noticeable. Taste is a nice mix of residual sugar notes with some bourbon and woody notes with some vanilla and black chocolates mixing in very well. The peppers kicks in later and kind of ruined it for me with way too much spicy notes. Body is full with nice creamy texture and good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Solid offering but too much spicy notes for my taste buds.
beer_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Proprietors 2015

review_blob: Can: Poured a bright golden color lager with a large pure white foamy head with good retention and some minor lacing. Aroma of light cereal notes with hints of smoke and some residual sugar notes is pleasant enough. Taste is a good mix of cereal notes with some hints of smoke and light dry hoppy notes. Body is full for style with good carbonation. Interesting offering and more complex then I was expecting.

Bottle: Poured a medium brown color porter with a large light brown foamy head with some retention and some lacing. Aroma of floral coffee notes with some roasted malt notes is quite pleasant. Taste is a nice mix of floral coffee with no astringency and some light roasted malt notes with light lactose notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Tasty porter with nice coffee profile and good drinkability.
